content: A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} is set for this link. To configure it,

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a hint or description for configuring link settings, specifically when three parameters are set. It typically appears in a UI component, such as a button or dialog, and provides context for users to understand how to configure the link further.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} is set' sounds awkward and doesn't translate well directly.  A more natural Arabic phrasing would be required to convey the same meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a phrasing like: "تم تحديد {{parameter1}}، و {{parameter2}}، و {{parameter3}} لهذا الارتباط."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses a comma (،) after '{{parameter1}}'.  While grammatically acceptable, it might be more consistent to use a conjunction like 'و' ('and') between all parameters for a more flowing feel, unless the original English intent had specific reason for the commas.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Evaluate whether using 'و' consistently between all parameters would improve readability and maintain the intended style.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation 'Pro tento odkaz je nastaven {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} a {{parameter3}}. Pro jeho nastavení' is grammatically awkward. The conjunction 'a' is somewhat repetitive. A more natural phrasing would omit it before the last parameter.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pro tento odkaz je nastaven {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} a {{parameter3}}. Nastavení tohoto odkazu je možné

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Um diese zu konfigurieren' is grammatically awkward. It lacks a clear subject and implies configuring 'these' without specifying what 'these' refers to.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Um diese Parameter zu konfigurieren,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}}' is not accurately translated in Greek. It should convey the idea of 'values' or 'settings' rather than simply 'parameters'. The use of 'παράμετρος' (parameter) is technically correct but doesn't quite fit the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation like: 'Έχει οριστεί μια τιμή {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, και {{parameter3}} για αυτήν τη σύνδεση' or 'Έχουν οριστεί οι ρυθμίσεις {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, και {{parameter3}} για αυτήν τη σύνδεση.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Spanish translation uses 'y' instead of 'ni' to connect parameter3, which can sound awkward. While 'y' is grammatically correct, 'ni' is often preferred in this context for a more natural flow, especially when describing a set or grouping.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Se establece un {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} ni {{parameter3}} para este enlace. Para configurarlo,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'is set' is translated as 'asetetaan', which is a passive form. A more natural translation would be something like 'on määritetty' or 'on asetettu', though 'on' is often omitted in Finnish.  'Asetetaan' implies that something is *actively* being set, while the English implies a state of being.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'on määritetty' or 'on asetettu', or simply 'määritetty' for a more natural flow.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'To configure it,' is translated as 'Määrittääksesi sen,' which is literal but sounds slightly awkward. It's more idiomatic to say something like 'Sen määrittämiseksi' or 'Sen asettamiseksi'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Sen määrittämiseksi' or 'Sen asettamiseksi' instead of 'Määrittääksesi sen'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} is set for this link" is best translated as "{{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} et {{parameter3}} sont définis pour ce lien." The current translation reads as "...sont *les* paramètres définis...", which introduces an unnecessary and slightly awkward emphasis on 'les' (the).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} et {{parameter3}} sont définis pour ce lien.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The ellipsis (...) is missing at the end of the Armenian translation to indicate continuation, similar to the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Add an ellipsis (...) at the end of the Armenian translation: «Այս հղման համար սահմանված են {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} և {{parameter3}} նշանները: Այն կարգավորելու համար…»

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian sentence structure is slightly awkward. While technically correct, it doesn't flow as naturally in Italian.  A more common and smoother phrasing would be to place 'Per questo link' at the end of the first clause.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sono impostati {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} e {{parameter3}} per questo link. Per configurarlo,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "設定するに" is grammatically awkward and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "To configure it." It's an incomplete sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 「設定するには」or「設定を行うには」

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} is set for this link" is a bit awkward. A more natural translation might be "{{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} are configured for this link." The current Korean translation directly mirrors the English phrasing, which isn't always ideal for natural Korean flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 이 링크에는 {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}}이 설정되었습니다. 구성하려면,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation uses Lao script characters, which is appropriate. However, ensure consistency in punctuation and spacing throughout the entire document where this translation is used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the broader document context to maintain consistent punctuation and spacing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the translation captures the general meaning, the phrase "ຖືກຕັ້ງໄວ້ສຳລັບລິ້ງນີ້" could be improved for naturalness. A more idiomatic expression might be considered.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "ຖືກກຳນົດໄວ້ສຳລັບລິ້ງນີ້" or "ແມ່ນການຕັ້ງຄ່າສຳລັບລິ້ງນີ້" depending on the precise nuance intended.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} is set for this link" is awkward. The direct translation '{{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} un {{parameter3}} ir iestatīts šai saitei' is equally awkward in Latvian. A more natural phrasing might be '{{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} un {{parameter3}} ir norādīti šai saitei' or '{{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} un {{parameter3}} ir konfigurējami šai saitei'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} un {{parameter3}} ir norādīti šai saitei.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb conjugation 'são' (are) doesn't agree with the subject 'Um {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} e {{parameter3}}' which is plural. It should be 'é' (is).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Um {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} e {{parameter3}} é definido para este link.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb agreement is incorrect. 'Um {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} e {{parameter3}}' should agree with 'são' (plural). It should be 'Uns {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} e {{parameter3}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Uns {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} e {{parameter3}} são definidos para este link.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation uses 'sunt setate' which implies 'are set' (plural), while the English uses a singular construction 'is set'. Depending on the intended meaning, a singular equivalent may be more accurate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Parametrul {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} și {{parameter3}} este setat pentru acest link.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation uses 'සකසා ඇත' which implies something was arranged or made. A more accurate translation of 'is set' in this context would be 'ති festgelegt කර ඇත' (thi festgelegt kara aetha) or 'දි තිබෙන' (dina thibena), implying a state of being set.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මෙම සබැඳිය සඳහා {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} සහ {{parameter3}} තිබෙන. එය වින්‍යාසගත කිරීමට,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation uses "Za to povezavo so nastavljeni..." which translates to "For this link, they are set..." This is grammatically correct, but sounds slightly awkward in Slovenian. A more natural phrasing would use a verb implying assignment or configuration directly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Za to povezavo so določeni {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} in {{parameter3}}. Če jih želite konfigurirati,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation retains the double curly braces for the parameters, mirroring the English. While technically correct, this isn't standard practice in Slovenian technical documentation.  It might be better to adapt the documentation style to remove the extra curly braces if possible.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Za to povezavo so določeni {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} in {{parameter3}}. Če jih želite konfigurirati,{

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation uses 'su postavljeni' which implies a passive voice. A more natural and direct translation would be 'postavljeni su'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, i {{parameter3}} postavljeni su za ovaj link. Da biste ih konfigurisali,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Ukrainian translation reads "Для цього посилання встановлено..." which translates to 'For this link, it is set...'. A more natural phrasing might be "Для цього посилання передбачено..." (For this link, it is provided/specified...).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Для цього посилання передбачено {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}} і {{parameter3}}. Щоб налаштувати посилання,
